hackathon-description-text: This event is co-organized by The Intern Project, a non-profit that serves over 7,000 Bay Area interns and young working professionals who come from all over the world.
hackathon-eligibility:
- You must be physically present at Hero Hacks.
- Teams should not consist of more than 5 members.

- Code can be written before the event and we even encourage you to build on top of your existing hacks. The only requirement is that you introduce a new wearable to your hack.
You must add a new wearable component to the project. i.e. if a previous hack didn't have wearables but want to continue working on it, they must incoporate a wearable device.
We'll also accept previous projects that already have a wearable device but must also include a new sponsors' device.
hackathon-requirements: Build anything involving wearable technology, IoT devices, or hardware. Please submit what you've built before and what you're adding to your project that has to do with wearables, IoT, or hardware.
hackathon-rules:
- You must be physically present at Hero Hacks.
- Teams should not consist of more than 5 members.

- Code can be written before the event and we even encourage you to build on top of your existing hacks. The only requirement is that you introduce a new wearable to your hack.
You must add a new wearable component to the project. i.e. if a previous hack didn't have wearables but want to continue working on it, they must incoporate a wearable device.
We'll also accept previous projects that already have a wearable device but must also include a new sponsors' device.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Myo Developer Kits to the team members with the best Myo application.

Best 2 apps developed during hack which utilize minimum one of the sensors in the Intelligent Headset, will receive one of the first Sales Packs of Intelligent Headsets for each member in team (max. 5 members).
Top team who makes the best Oculus Hack will get DK2 dev kits to everyone.
One team member gets a cool smart glasses that can record video live time.
We gave honorable mentions to teams that did really well.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=600 Harrison Street, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Have you pushed the boundaries of wearable technology? Are you forward thinking in building the next generation of wearable technology and how it's used?
How difficult was it to create your hack? Did you leap through obstacles to accomplish your vision? Did you teach yourself things you didn't know and didn't know you could do?
Does you hack solve a real problem and attempt to make people's lives easier?

hackathon-location-address: 600 Harrison Street, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA
hackathon-description-header: Hero Hacks is a weekend hackathon with several focus tracks including wearable, hardware and IoT devices.
